nodes.bodyText: Delete this class.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,57 @@
+package io.flutter.actions;

nodes.bodyText: Get this key from an environment variable. And document it :)

Ah yeah, I have tried it as an environment variable, but I'm unclear on whether we eventually want to expose the key  or if this is something that's part of the build but not in the source code. Is it okay to have the key in our .iml file?

In general, auth keys are not included in source code, whether java or iml.
I'm not sure what the commercial auth is like. I saw some issues referring to files used for authentication, but that may have been an earlier version. In any case, this will need to be part of the build process.
Consider doing something like reading the key from a properties file, having a demo / mock key checked in for that file, and overwriting the file with the real key as part of the build process.
Delete this.

nodes.bodyText: This should be rolled back. I'm pretty sure we settled on enumerating all imports.

I think we should do a little refactoring. See AddToAppUtils.getStaticFieldValue(). If you move that method to, say, SystemUtils then you can just use it here. Unfortunately, I defined it in a class that's part of flutter-studio so you can't use it directly.

Should this function return the addUrl method? Something like Method method = SystemUtils.getStaticFieldValue(URLClassLoader.class, Function<String, void>.class, "addUrl"); to replace everything before method.invoke(classLoader, url); ?
Hmm, I don't know what I was thinking. See various methods in ReflectionUtils for helpers that do some of what you're doing here. Please ignore AddToAppUtils.
I'm not sure JetBrains approves of outsiders (like us) modifying their internal data. If we make this "Google" then it can be shared with all IDEs, and the file will be only downloaded once.
I think we only want to start this if we know this is a flutter project; I'd move this down somewhere below the declaresFlutter check.

How confident are we with the process here (downloading, jsbrowser, ...)? We should probably do something like have an experimental setting in our preferences, and let people opt into trying this out for release or two. That would allow us to iron out any issues.

We're going to start with these features disabled, since there are some other pieces that would be too much to add in this change. I think it would make sense to add a setting to opt in/out, especially since we will need a permanent way to opt out.
nit: todos should use the name of the cl author.
why the invoke later? I would have thought this code was already running on the ui thread.
I'm not sure how to tell, actually. This is called from a process listening for devtools to start, is that on a separate thread?
an easy way to tell is to set a breakpoint and see what thread you are on or add an assert that you are on the UI thread.

Should be ENABLE_JX_BROWSER not ENABLE_JXBROWSER. Also move this check to outside this class to where setup is called. That way it is obvious by looking at that code that we aren't doing anything unless the flag is set.
log something if making the directory fails and abort.
Are these blocking calls that take over 10ms to initialize the Engine + browser? If so this work should be done on a background thread.

Actually, I'm still confused about this - should I put these lines into invokeLater as well? Or is it fine to remove invokeLater because all of this is on a non-main thread (verified that this is the case).
Which thread is it on specifically? Even if it isn't the main thread it could be bad to block the thread for a couple seconds waiting for the engine to load.
you should use exponential backoff and we should display a user visible message if the download fails.
If we don't have to manage downloads among different IDEs then we don't need this check.
nit: address -> url
update DevToolsUtils to accept passing in embed=true and pass in the tabName instead of hardcoding to the inspector.

generateDevToolsUrl has a page param but is this now inactive? e.g. the method can produce this URL (from a test): "http://127.0.0.1:9100/?ide=Android-Studio&uri=http%3A%2F%2F127.0.0.1%3A50224%2FWTFTYus3IPU%3D%2F#timeline" but adding #timeline doesn't seem to do anything when I try in devtools.
add a todo: we should use a different icon based on the tab and we should copy the icons from the inspector toolbar rather than using the Phone icon.
Nit: for consistency with singletons in the rest of the code base call this getInstance() instead of get().
make 100 a constant and consider removing if using exponential backoff.
Do you mean keep increasing the sleep time with more iterations? This would still require some stopping condition, you're thinking something other than number of attempts?

yes. what you would do is double the time to sleep each time.
rather than having a stopping condition, what would be ideal would be to have the code that displays the browser check whether the browser is available yet and if it is not available display the following:

"Installing JX Browser" (for the common case where JX Browser has not failed to download)
JX Browser Download failed (retrying in X seconds) for the case where the download has failed at least once.
This is similar to what you see if you open gmail when offline. Bonus points: add a "retry download now" button.
That way users only see the message about a failed download when they care when they are about to try to use the inspector and it isn't available.
Will be adding panel messages in a next change.
this break seems wrong. The list of files will sometimes be missing a file.
Wow good catch. Could be helpful to add unit tests in a next change.

because it could have been some time from when the action was requested until we are ready to launch, we need to make sure the contentManager has not been disposed or perhaps that the project is still valid.

what if the other ide was killed while the file was being downloaded? Now JXBrowser will never work. We need a generally more robust way to do this or we will get a lot of hard to track down bugs. I would suggest we err on the side of a simpler solution than a more efficient one. It is preferable if it wasn't possible for multiple IDEs to be trying to download files to the same locations.
Removing this since we're going to do a download per IDE
keep in mind if the IDE is killed you may not get a chance to delete this file. Likely a file lock that is released if the IDE is killed or similar would be more robust.
Removing the tempLoadingFile since we will only try once on initial startup of an IDE. We can let users manually try another download if they open up a devtools panel.

nit:
Add message to panel to communicate --> add a message to communicate
do we need to handle if devtools failed to install?
Yes, what would make sense here? I could pull the code below that starts the old inspector into a separate function and run that instead. Or maybe just display a message?
why is this code needed here? this seems copied from somewhere and not clearly relevant.
add your username to the TODO
what exception are you expecting? should we delete the cached browser files in this case?

toURL can throw a malformed URL exception. I'm not sure how to handle this case. We could delete the files, but if this occurred because of a bug in our file naming, then it would be annoying for the user to have to keep downloading the files to a bad spot each time they opened their IDE.
are we catching this exception? It would be nice to just fail gracefully if a platform we don't support is used.
Ah true. Changed this to a checked exception.
should this be removed?
